title: Dablova past / The Devil's Trap (Frantisek Vlacil, 1962)
description:
With that seemingly simple concept, Frantisek Vlacil lays the inherent inadequacies of shortsighted religious fanaticism bare for all who care to see. The DevilÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Trap, the first of his three historical films, is set in an era where Holy Mother Church held sway over every facet of life. When an unprecedented drought strikes, and a single millerÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s fields remain unnaturally moist, the ruling classes capitalize on fear mongering and naivety in an effort to regain their stranglehold on the Bohemian (now a part of the Czech Republic) economy. Refreshingly, Vlacil grants humanity to the serfs that would rise to Frankenstein-esque levels of paranoia in a lesser film. The  congregation may not be willing to look to the ground, but theyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re certainly perceptive enough to see when the lambÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s wool is about to be pulled over their eyes. 

Our rip from Czech DVD with custom eng subs.
